sentence: Nobody came running.

sentence: The painter expressed with an obscenity his lack of concern for the tribulations of his survivors.

sentence: He or she is going to live on a happy, roomy, clean, rich planet, thanks to population control.

sentence: And then he saw the telephone booth in the corner of the room.

sentence: Wehling continued to stare at the same spot on the wall.

sentence: The law said that no newborn child could survive unless the parents of the child could find someone who would volunteer to die.

sentence: And then he decided he had had about enough of life in the Happy Garden of Life, too, and he came slowly down from the ladder. ~~~ He took Wehling's pistol, really intending to shoot himself.

sentence: Wehling,"" said the waiting father, sitting up, red-eyed and frowzy.

sentence: "The invisible man," said Wehling.

sentence: Nobody, seemingly, heard the shots.

sentence: Men and women in white, doctors and nurses, turned the soil, planted seedlings, sprayed bugs, spread fertilizer.

sentence: Why don't you have a little consideration for the people who have to clean up after you?""

sentence: A sardonic old man, about two hundred years old, sat on a stepladder, painting a mural he did not like.
translation: Un hombre mordaz, ya mayor, de unos doscientos años, estaba sentado en la escalera y pintaba un mural que no le gustaba.

sentence: Guess what was just born,"" he said.

sentence: The painter pondered the mournful puzzle of life demanding to be born and, once born, demanding to be fruitful ... to multiply and to live as long as possible—to do all that on a very small planet that would have to last forever.
translation: El pintor reflexionó sobre el triste rompecabezas de la vida que exige nacer y, una vez en el mundo, exige fructificar… multiplicarse y vivir el máximo posible, y cumplir con este destino en un pequeñísimo planeta que debe durar para siempre.

sentence: I don't know anything about art.""

sentence: They're all fine, and so is the mother.

sentence: The mural he was working on depicted a very neat garden.

sentence: Is this where I'm supposed to come?"" she said to the painter.

sentence: Who doesn't admire him?"" she said, worshiping the portrait of Hitz. ~~~ It was the portrait of a tanned, white-haired, omnipotent Zeus, two hundred and forty years old.
translation: —¿Y quién no lo admira? ~~~ —dijo, mirando con veneración el retrato de Atiza. ~~~ Era el retrato de un Zeus omnipotente, de pelo blanco y moreno de doscientos cuarenta años—.

sentence: "In the year 2000," said Dr. Hitz, "before scientists stepped in and laid down the law, there wasn't even enough drinking water to go around, and nothing to eat but sea-weed—and still people insisted on their right to reproduce like jackrabbits. ~~~ And their right, if possible, to live forever."
translation: —En el año 2000 —dijo el doctor Atiza—, antes de que los científicos intervinieran y aplicaran la ley, no existía siquiera suficiente agua potable para todos y solo se podían comer algas, y, a pesar de todo, la gente insistía en su derecho a reproducirse como conejos; y en su derecho, a ser posible, de vivir eternamente.

sentence: "Your city thanks you; your country thanks you; your planet thanks you.
translation: La ciudad le da las gracias; el país le da las gracias; el planeta le da las gracias.

sentence: If you don't like it here, Grandpa—"" he said, and he finished the thought with the trick telephone number that people who didn't want to live any more were supposed to call.
translation: «Abuelo, si no le gusta…», dijo y completó la idea con el número de teléfono con truco al que había que llamar si ya no querías seguir viviendo.

sentence: "Ah, You... you admire him, eh?" he said.

sentence: And then he shot himself, making room for all three of his children.

sentence: Without population control, human beings would now be packed on this surface of this old planet like drupelets on a blackberry!

sentence: But the deepest thanks of all is from future generations."

sentence: "I think it's perfectly keen," said Wehling tautly. ~~~ "Would you like to go back to the good old days, when the population of the Earth was twenty billion—about to become forty billion, then eighty billion, then one hundred and sixty billion?

sentence: We could probably fit you in late this afternoon, sir,"" she said.
